summary: This is an email chain from August 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing a new hire joining the team. The new hire is noted to have previously worked in the Public Corruption unit where he prosecuted 'boring cases like Jeffrey Epstein.' The document shows internal communication within the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Sends an email on August 13, 2020, thanking colleagues and expressing excitement about joining a new team.

persons.name: U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission
persons.context: Sends a reply email on August 12, 2020, welcoming a new team member aboard.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in an email as an example of 'boring cases' prosecuted by a new team member who previously worked in the Public Corruption unit.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Colleagues communicating via email about a new team member joining, indicating a working relationship.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The attorney references Epstein as a case previously prosecuted by a colleague in the Public Corruption unit.

events.title: Email introduction of new team member
events.description: An email is sent introducing a new hire to the IIG team, noting his background in prosecuting cases like Jeffrey Epstein's.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Welcome email response
events.description: A response email is sent thanking colleagues and expressing excitement about joining the new team.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The email chain is from August 2020 and involves personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office and SEC.
A new hire is joining the IIG team who previously worked in the Public Corruption unit.
Jeffrey Epstein is referenced as an example of 'boring cases' prosecuted by the new team member.
The correspondence indicates internal communication about staffing within the Southern District of New York.
The document shows professional onboarding communication between legal colleagues.
